poem:
Night in Mumbai

In the city's night,  
lights waver and weave,  
skies stitched with glimmers—  
all twinkling tales yet told.  
Each train a thread,  
each window a world;  
a constellation of lives  
drawn dream-bright,  
woven vast and close,  
unspoken stories—  
our infinite Mumbai.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "All We Imagine As Light review – Cannes prize-winning Indian drama is a quiet, tender marvel Mumbai is more than a city. And behind each flickering window, inside every snaking commuter train, there is a whole world with its own myriad". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
